docker:/CacheFrom:CacheFrom.description: CacheFrom may be used to specify build stages to use for the Docker build cache. The final image is always implicitly included.

stages.description: An optional list of build stages to use for caching. Each build stage in this list will be built explicitly and pushed to the target repository. A given stageâ€™s image will be tagged as "[stage-name]".

docker:/DockerBuild:DockerBuild.description: DockerBuild may be used to specify detailed instructions about how to build a container.

args.description: An optional map of named build-time argument variables to set during the Docker build. This flag allows you to pass built-time variables that can be accessed like environment variables inside the `RUN` instruction.

context.description: context is a path to a directory to use for the Docker build context, usually the directory in which the Dockerfile resides (although dockerfile may be used to choose a custom location independent of this choice). If not specified, the context defaults to the current working directory; if a relative path is used, it is relative to the current working directory that Pulumi is evaluating.

dockerfile.description: dockerfile may be used to override the default Dockerfile name and/or location. By default, it is assumed to be a file named Dockerfile in the root of the build context.

env.description: Environment variables to set on the invocation of `docker build`, for example to support `DOCKER_BUILDKIT=1 docker build`.

extraOptions.description: An optional catch-all string to provide extra CLI options to the docker build command. For example, use to specify `--network host`.

target.description: The target of the dockerfile to build

password.description: Password for login to the target Docker registry.

server.description: Docker registry server URL to push to. Some common values include: DockerHub: `docker.io` or `https://index.docker.io/v1` Azure Container Registry: `<name>.azurecr.io` AWS Elastic Container Registry: `<account>.dkr.ecr.us-east-2.amazonaws.com` Google Container Registry: `<name>.gcr.io`.

username.description: Username for login to the target Docker registry.

docker:index/image:Image.description: A docker.Image resource represents a Docker image built locally which is published and made available via a remote Docker registry. This can be used to ensure that a Docker source directory from a local deployment environment is built and pushed to a cloud-hosted Docker registry as part of a Pulumi deployment, so that it can be referenced as an image input from other cloud services that reference Docker images - including Kubernetes Pods, AWS ECS Tasks, and Azure Container Instances.

build.description: The Docker build context, as a folder path or a detailed DockerBuild object.

imageName.description:
The qualified image name that will be pushed to the remote registry. Must be a supported image name for the target registry user. This name can include a tag at the end. If provided all pushed image resources will contain that tag as well.

Either [imageName] or [localImageName] can have a tag. However, if both have a tag, then those tags must match.

localImageName.description:
The docker image name to build locally before tagging with imageName. If not provided, it will be given the value of to [imageName]. This name can include a tag at the end. If provided all pushed image resources will contain that tag as well.

Either [imageName] or [localImageName] can have a tag. However, if both have a tag, then those tags must match.

registry.description: Credentials for the docker registry to push to.

baseImageName.description: The base image name that was built and pushed. This does not include the id annotation, so is not pinned to the specific build performed by this docker.Image.

digest.deprecationMessage: This will have the same value as [imageName], but will be removed in the future.
digest.description: It can be used to get a unique name for this specific image, but is not the actual repository digest value.

id.deprecationMessage: This will have the same value as [imageName], but will be removed in the future.

imageName.description: The unique pinned image name on the remote repository.

registryServer.description: The server the image is located at.
